DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Salles-Cunha SX.;Salles-Cunha S;Salles Cunha S;Salles Cunha SX;Sergio Xavier Salles Cunha;Sergio Xavier de Salles Cunha;Sergio X Salles-Cunha;Sergio X Salles Cunha;SALLES-CUNHA, SERGIO X.;SALLES-CUNHA, SERGIO XAVIER;CUNHA, SERGIO XAVIER SALLES

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduao em Eletronica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (ITA 1969), mestrado/doutorado em Biomedical Engineering - Marquette University, Milwaukee, WI, USA (1972/1978). Experincia em ultrassonografia vascular e outras tcnicas no invasivas de diagnstico de doencas arteriais e venosas. Membro Honorario: Society of Vascular Ultrasound, Asociacion Colombiana de Angiologia y Cirugia Vascular e Sociedade Brasileira de Angiologia e Cirurgia Vascular-Regionaisl Santa Catarina e Espirito Santo. Pioneer award, Society of Vascular Ultrasound. Google scholar: >1800 citaes, indice h:25, indice 10: 50
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor degree in Electronics from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1969), Master of Sciences in Biomedical Engineering from Marquette University (1972) and doctorate in Biomedical Engineering from Marquette University (1978). Has experience in arterial and venous diseases with emphasis on vascular ultrasound. Honorary member of the Society of Vascular Ultrasound, Asociacion Colombiana de Angiologia y Cirugia Vascular and Brazilian Society of Angiology and Vascular Surgery - regional chapters of Santa Catarina and Espirito Santo states. Society of Vascular Ultrasound Pioneer award recipient. Pubmed.org lists 81 articles under the search Salles-Cunha S

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Aplicacoes vasculares da UHUS a varias condicoes vasculares como placa aterosclerotica, trombo arterial ou venoso, rim normal ou transplantado, etc
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: USVH or HVUS has the opportunity to revolutionize modern vascular ultrassonography. Brazilian research performed in Curitiba and Campinas and being initiated in the Northeast has addressed potential applications in venous thrombosis, kidney transplant, carotid plaque, linfedema, other types of edema, animal atherosclerotic research and treatment of venous insufficiency among many potential applications. The ultrasound image is processed to enhance details not perceived by the human visual system. The technique is quantitative and demonstrates tecidual changes. For example: USVH could replace actual histology as a descriptor of atherosclerotic plaque characteristics and perceived risk of plaque components. In addition, it could predict potential success or problems according to the type of treatment proposed. Venous thrombosis treatment could be guided or changed according to USVH data. USVH could be more sensitive than clinical or other findings while detecting behavior of a transplanted kidney USVH could help classify types of leg edema and could grade treatment improvements. The number of applications of USVH is limited only by the imagination to select the appropriate US images and their potential clinical utility.
